required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: High School Start Time and Teen Migraine Frequency
clinical_study.official_title: High School Start Time and Adolescent Migraine Frequency

brief_summary.textblock:
Migraine is common in adolescents and can cause missed school and disability.
The American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) recommends that high schools start no earlier than 8:30 AM in order to accommodate the physiologic needs of adolescents—whose brains naturally want to fall asleep later and wake up later and who still need to get at least 8 hours of sleep per night to function optimally—however, only about 18% of US high schools comply with this AAP recommendation. There is a relationship between adequate sleep and migraine. The investigators aim to determine whether high school students with migraine who attend high schools that comply with this AAP recommendation have lower migraine frequency than those that do not.
If so, it would argue for advocating for changes in high school policy to optimize health of adolescents with migraine.

detailed_description.textblock: Study design: This is an observational study of high-school students in the U.S. who have migraine and who attend a standard high school (i.e. are not home schooled or online schooled). They will complete a one-time online survey answering questions about their headaches and their schedule--particularly schedule aspects related to school and sleep.

primary_outcome.description: How many headache days experienced in the last month

secondary_outcome.measure: Hours of sleep on typical school night
secondary_outcome.description: Respondent's estimate of hours of sleep on a typical school night
Respondent's estimate of typical bedtime on school night

secondary_outcome.measure: Typical wake up time on a school day
secondary_outcome.description: Respondent's estimate of typical wakeup time on a school day

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of missed breakfasts in a typical school week
secondary_outcome.description: Respondent's estimate of how many times they miss breakfast in a typical school week

secondary_outcome.measure: Acute headache medication days per month
secondary_outcome.description: How many days per month respondent uses acute headache medication
Headache related disability score--Total score ranges from 0-246

arm_group.arm_group_label: School start time 8:30 AM or later
arm_group.description: These are high schoolers with migraine who attend a school that begins at 8:30 AM or later (i.e. follows AAP recommendation re: high school start time).
These are high schoolers with migraine who attend a school that begins earlier than 8:30 AM (i.e. does not follow AAP recommendation re: high school start time).

intervention.description: The time that the school starts
intervention.arm_group_label: School start time 8:30 AM or later

study_pop.textblock: U.S. High school students with migraine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. Live in the U.S.
2. In 9th-12th grade
3. Attends a high school that is outside of the home (i.e. not home-schooled or online schooled)
4. High school has a consistent start time all 5 days of the week
5. Has migraine by International Classification of Headache Disorders criteria
6. Can read and write in English
Exclusion criteria: NA
